== Overview ==\nReadingCircle is a [[social navigation]] and [[social comparison]] interface to engage students into online reading  and facilitate the reading and navigation process \n\n== Project ==\n\n* [[Engaging Students in Online Reading Through Social Progress Visualization]]\n\n== Demo == \nYou can demo the first two versions of ReadingCircle, from [http://columbus.exp.sis.pitt.edu/development/readingcircle_film/index.php?usr=dguerra&grp=testeraeder01&sid=XXXXX&bookid=tdo&docno=tdo-2000&page=1&course=tdo version 1] and from  [http://columbus.exp.sis.pitt.edu/development/readingcircle/index.php?usr=rctester&grp=testeraeder01&sid=XXXXX&bookid=tdo&docno=tdo-2000&page=1&course=tdo version 2].\n\n== Publications == \n\nGuerra, J., Parra, D., and Brusilovsky, P. (2013) Encouraging Online Student Reading with Visualization. In:  Proceedings of 2nd Workshop on Intelligent Support for Learning in Groups at the 16th Annual Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Education, AIED 2013, Memphis, TN, USA [http://ceur-ws.org/Vol-1009/0308.pdf]\n\n== See Also ==\n\n* [[Knowledge Sea II | Knowledge Sea II]]\n* [[Progressor |  Progressor]]\n* [[ProgressorPlus | Progressor+ ]]\n\n== Screenshots ==\n\n[[Image:Readingcircle1.png|left|thumb|450px|Screenshot of Reading circle, with reading material on the right side and the sunburst visualization on the left.]]\n\n[[Image:Readingcircle2.png|left|thumb|400px|Comparison mode, allows a user to compare side-by-side with other user or class average.]]
